visor effect linked to everything we will say about specter in general > such is the difference btwn le spectre ou le revenant de l’esprit, fut-ce de l’esprit au sense de fantôme en general > supernatural, paradoxical phenomenology, ungraspable visibility of the invisible, the non-sensuous sensuous of Capital, intangibility of a proper body w/out flesh [see p. 156 are specter/ghost different?]
spectral interrupts all specularity, de-synchronizes, calls us to anachrony: we do not see who looks at us
visor effect: “to feel ourselves seen by a look which it will always be impossible to cross” > the inheritance of law
both mask and helmet share the (supreme sign of) power: looking w/out being seen
specter first of all sees us
figures of the ghost first of all faces, matter of masks, helmet, visor
